text: Donna Britt (July 10, 1958 â€“ January 21, 2021) was a longtime television news anchor at WAFB in Baton Rouge. She co-anchored the station's top rated 6 PM and 10 PM news broadcasts. As a student, she had been working for WYNK radio, and so in 1981 she decided to get a temporary job with WAFB, the local CBS affiliate. She quickly moved from weekend reporter to full-time reporter to host of morning news shows to prime time, where she anchored 9 News.WAFB Profile Page Retrieved May 3, 2010 Britt was diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis in 2017, and retired the following year. She died at her home on January 21, 2021, at age 62. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Journalists from Louisiana Category:American television personalities Category:Writers from Baton Rouge, Louisiana Category:People from Biloxi, Mississippi Category:Deaths from motor neurone disease
title: Donna Britt
